(T-158) Obtain user consent as required before processing personal data.
(T-175) Document procedures for providing privacy notices to data subjects.
(T-176) Update and communicate changes to privacy practices to data subjects in a timely manner.
(T-177) Communicate choices available for collection, use, retention, disclosure, and disposal of personal data.
(T-178) Obtain explicit consent for processing personal data when required.
(T-179) Document the basis for determining implicit consent where permitted.
(T-181) Explain the need for explicit consent and the consequences of failure to provide it.
(T-192) Obtain consent before disclosing personal data to third parties for privacy objectives.
(T-162) Document retention and disposal guidelines for personal data.
(T-180) Collect personal data only for stated privacy objectives.
(T-182) Limit personal-data use to identified privacy objectives.
(T-183) Retain personal data in line with privacy objectives and legal requirements.
(T-184) Securely dispose of personal data when no longer required.
(T-201) Maintain complete and accurate personal-data records throughout the lifecycle.
(T-163) Honour Subject-Access Requests in accordance with this policy.
(T-185) Grant data subjects access to stored personal data for review.
(T-186) Provide copies of personal data upon request in electronic or physical form.
(T-187) Inform data subjects of access denial and the reasons when applicable.
(T-188) Correct, amend, or append personal data on valid data-subject request.
(T-189) Communicate corrections to third parties as committed or required.
(T-190) Inform data subjects of correction denial and the reasons when applicable.
(T-200) Provide an accounting of personal data held and disclosures on request.
(T-165) Conduct Data Protection Impact Assessments to evaluate regulatory risks.
(T-166) Perform vendor privacy-risk assessments for third parties handling personal data.
(T-168) Assess suspected data breaches and notify affected parties without undue delay.
(T-159) Maintain a list of contractual privacy obligations derived from customer contracts.
(T-164) Ensure appropriate remediation when personal data is shared with vendors.
(T-173) Document a vendor-management policy that incorporates privacy-risk assessment guidance.
(T-195) Obtain written privacy commitments from vendors and third parties with personal-data access.
(T-196) Assess vendor privacy compliance periodically and initiate corrective action when needed.
(T-197) Require vendors to notify the organization of unauthorized personal-data disclosures.
(T-198) Report vendor notifications to the appropriate personnel per incident-response procedures.
(T-172) Apply documented procedures to ensure cross-border personal-data transfers comply with applicable laws.
(T-161) Require authorized approval for logical-access provisioning to privacy-related systems.
(T-174) Provide employees with instructions for reporting privacy failures, incidents, and complaints.
(T-169) Document guidelines for notifying customers and stakeholders of privacy breaches.
(T-170) Maintain records of privacy-incident investigations and response actions.
(T-171) Document guidelines for notifying customers and stakeholders of PII breaches.
(T-199) Provide breach notifications to affected data subjects, regulators, and others as required.
(T-191) Disclose personal data to third parties only with explicit data-subject consent.
(T-193) Create and retain accurate, timely records of authorized personal-data disclosures.
(T-194) Create and retain accurate, timely records of unauthorized personal-data disclosures.
(T-202) Implement a process for receiving, addressing, and resolving privacy inquiries, complaints, and disputes.
(T-203) Monitor privacy-program compliance and take corrective actions for identified deficiencies.
(T-204) Communicate resolutions of privacy inquiries, complaints, and disputes to data subjects.

Employees must submit privacy-related exception requests through the ticketing system, including business justification, compensating controls, and requested duration. The Privacy Officer and Information Security Officer must jointly approve, document, and time-limit each exception, which is reviewed at or before expiration.

Audits, monitoring tools, and incident reviews detect non-compliance with this policy. Suspected violations are reported to the Privacy Officer, Information Security Officer, and HR for investigation. Confirmed violations follow HR disciplinary tiers—verbal warning, written warning, suspension, or termination—based on severity, and may involve regulatory notification or legal action.

name: Política de Prevención de Delitos
description: Política que establece el compromiso de la organización con la prevención de delitos económicos según la Ley 21595

content.text: Política de Prevención de Delitos Económicos
Esta política establece el marco para la prevención de delitos económicos según la Ley 21595, aplicable a todos los colaboradores, directivos y terceros que actúen en nombre de la organización.
La organización se compromete a prevenir la comisión de delitos económicos mediante la implementación de un modelo de prevención efectivo.
Se prohíbe expresamente cualquier conducta que pueda constituir un delito económico según la legislación vigente.
Todos los colaboradores deben conocer y cumplir esta política y el modelo de prevención implementado.
Se designará un Encargado de Prevención con autonomía y recursos suficientes para implementar y supervisar el modelo de prevención.
Se establece un canal de denuncias confidencial para reportar cualquier conducta sospechosa o irregular relacionada con delitos económicos.
Código de Ética de la Organización

name: Política de Canal de Denuncias
description: Política que establece el funcionamiento del canal de denuncias para prevenir delitos económicos

content.text: Establecer un canal seguro y confidencial para que colaboradores y terceros puedan reportar conductas irregulares o sospechosas relacionadas con delitos económicos.
Las denuncias pueden realizarse de forma anónima o identificada a través de los canales establecidos.
Todas las denuncias serán tratadas con estricta confidencialidad.
Se prohíbe cualquier represalia contra denunciantes de buena fe.
El Encargado de Prevención investigará todas las denuncias recibidas.
